website_summaries.verdict: Another quality choice in menstrual cups, this stands out for being well-made and good for first-time users.
pros: Simple to use and made of quality materials, the Lena cup scores points for those with active lifestyles
Company stands out for its great customer service
cons: Some users feel this cup is slightly shorter than other styles on the market

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love it
customer_reviews.text: I've used another brand of menstrual cup in the past that worked well, then had an IUD for a few years and no longer got my period. After getting rid of the IUD, I got this cup knowing that my period would return and sadly, it just doesn't work for me without major, major leaking, even without a heavy enough flow to fill the cup. I found the cup to be easy to insert and position, but even after checking that it's properly positioned, I have to go back to the bathroom within an hour because I can feel myself leaking. I never had this problem with my previous cup, so I know it's likely my anatomy that's the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Not for me...
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY wanted to like this. I've been using Softcups for years, and have raved about using menstrual cups versus tampons or pads. The disposable aspect has always bothered me as it seemed wasteful, so I gave the Lena cup a try. Big mistake. The silicone is so thick that it made folding and keeping it in place it feel almost impossible. Once in, the fit was VERY tight and I felt a burning sensation. I took it out only to be sore for a few hours afterward. I know every body is different so I'm not surprised there are people who have had success with it. However, I'll be going back to Softcup.
customer_reviews.author: Jen PDX

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love with the big kahuna! Large is in charge!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing! Years ago I tried a cup and had a horrible experience since I'm a heavy bleeder. Today is my day one and one of my two heaviest days and words cannot describe how wonderful it has been. Well I guess as wonderful as a period can get 😉. It's so much easier than running to look for a tampon🏃🏾‍♀️. This is the big one 👀so you have to be comfortable fitting it inside you😜, so if you get past this hurdle you are golden🤩. Right now I can't see myself going back to tampons.💃🏾 Oh don't forget to push like doing the number 2 when you squat so it'll release much easier.😀 Happy Perioding❤❤
customer_reviews.author: jevona

customer_reviews.title: Rewrite of a review after 5 months of use
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love the Lena cup. It fits better than the Diva Cup (which I found painful). However, no matter what this cup doesn't suction fully and I have leakage. It's not a lot of leakage but it's enough that I need to wear a pad with it (which for me is annoying bc the reason I want to use a cup is to reduce waste). Anyways, I have watched the videos on YouTube, read their manual every single month, and still it won't create a suction and has leaks. About me I ordered size 2 and have had two vaginal births. :(
customer_reviews.author: S.Haba

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cup if your cycle isnt super heavy
customer_reviews.text: This cup is great! As an 18 year old virgin I can say that it was scary at first to try to fit that cup inside, but with practice and you being on your period, it becomes less complicated. Once set inside, it doesn't move and you can't feel anything AT ALL. Removing it isn't hard either if your relaxed and not panicking. My only issue was that my cup leaked after a few hours, but that's mostly cause my flow was super heavy and I was still new to wearing the cup. Anyways if your indecisive about getting this cup, I recommend you trying it out, there's even a 15% coupon online so why not?
customer_reviews.author: Tania

customer_reviews.title: Check online for coupons; there’s almost always something. 10/10 reccomend this!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent alternative to the wasteful and chemical filled products we have. Check online for coupons for this product there’s usually atleast a few bucks off, I think I got $5 off mine. It’s definitely more stiff than I guess other cups are so prepare for that, but honestly as a small woman down there after my first try with it I don’t feel it anymore. It doesn’t hurt to put in or remove but it absolutely requires a comfort-ability with yourself to be able to use it; you definitely learn a lot about your period that’s for sure. 10/10 would recommend it’s an amazing way to fight back against single use plastics, waste products etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Too Big (Lena small is 5 star!)
customer_reviews.text: I think Lena cup is awesome, but this size feels very different from the smaller one. It’s a lot stiffer which made it really difficult for me to use. If you are thinking about going for the larger size just be careful. I’m just a bit bummed that I spent money on this and can’t return it (cause that’d be wrong to even try returning it! Haha). I however will continue to use the smaller size because it’s Awesome! I highly recommend Lena to anyone, but be mindful of the sizes
customer_reviews.author: Slopher

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Will never go back to tampons
customer_reviews.text: I actually purchased this as a joke. My coworkers and I took turns “Testing” different products that came up in Facebook ads. I got stuck with this one. The first cycle I used it, it was a little tricky. Removal was difficult and made me nervous. Once I read the instruction book ( probably should have done that first ) it came easier. I have used this for a few months now and honestly would never go back to tampons. My cramps have decreased, I have saved a ton of money, and I’m so happy I tested this one out .
customer_reviews.author: Dana Sab

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: The packaging was good, all recyclable material. When you sterilize (boil) it, it actually ends up smelling really nice. Lemon smelling 🍋. Be patient when using menstrual cups, it takes time to get used to. Out of the three different folds (C fold, tuck in fold, and 7 fold) the 7 fold ended up working for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: game changer...period!
customer_reviews.text: it took me a while to be comfortable with the idea of having a littleness plastic cup instereted in my hoohaa, but I’m so glad I made the switch. For whatever reason; more sustainable, more practical, more environmentally friendly, have a safe cycle, less harmful chemicals...just buy one! I’m two days in my cycle and really pleased with buying this product. Very simple to use and to clean, and I’m not hurting the planet by wasting countless tampons or pads.. win, win, win. This makes having periods a little less stressful.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa A.

customer_reviews.title: no go
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I hated this cup. I have been using the blossom cup for years and love it. I replace it every few months, and decided I would try a new one. Maybe this one isn't the right shape for me, but it doesn't seal well no matter how hard I try, and it pushes on my bladder and constantly makes me feel like I have to pee. I stopped using it and switched back to blossom and have been happy about cups again. My friend wanted to try a cup and I ordered this for her, and she hated it too, I think this one is much harder to use. sorry Lena
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I have purchased this cup. I was very happy to see that this was available in my favorite color Purple! This cup is extremely durable, cleans easy and is way to use. It is also flexible, so you can't even feel it. I have endometriosis, so I suffer from irregular spotting. It's not enough to wear a tampon, but it's enough to ruin your underwear. The Lena cup is the perfect solution! I can wear this all day long and empty it before bed. I can also wear it and receive oral sex while I am bleeding! No leaks! Live this product!
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: Not every cup is for every woman
customer_reviews.text: I think it’s important to note, despite how high quality and awesome this cup is made, it might not be the right fit for your body. This was my first menstrual cup purchase, and it didn’t end up being “the one” for me. If your cup leaks, despite trouble shooting and making sure it’s inserted correctly, you probably need to try another shape/manufacturer. If it’s uncomfortable despite effort to insert differently etc, try another manufacturer. Don’t write off menstrual cups if one isn’t the perfect fit for you your first try.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly B.

customer_reviews.title: It hurts, it leaks. I have a high ...
customer_reviews.text: It hurts, it leaks. I have a high cervix and a heavy flow. I got the large, but it hurts to leave in there. I do need the size due to flow, but it irritates my lady parts. I wish it were different, but the amount of cramping it caused was too much.
customer_reviews.author: Annette L.

customer_reviews.title: Best investment for yourself
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit I watched probably 15 YouTube videos about menstrual cups before buying one. I wanted to know what I was getting myself into. I can say now 6 months post-purchase it was the best decision I’ve made for my period. I empty it once in the morning once at night and wear a thin panty liner on my heavy days just in case it leaks. I absolutely love walking past the tampon aisle knowing I don’t need them anymore. Plus it’s so much better for the environment I don’t know why everyone doesn’t switch!
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner cup for the average person
customer_reviews.text: The Lena cup is a great cup to start out with if you've never used menstrual cups before and have an average cervix. The cup is medium-firm and is great when inserted properly. Don't hesitate to try the cup even if you've never used tampons. I've been always used pads and this cup works like a charm. There's a learning curve and you have to get comfortable with your body but it's a great experience!
customer_reviews.author: Viv Ramont

customer_reviews.title: Bye bye tampons!
customer_reviews.text: My friend RAVED about her diva cup and I was curious, but while on birth control I didn’t get my period. Recently I stopped birth control for the first time in several years and decided to try a cup. What made me choose Lena initially was the small size and the price. This little gal is flexible, easy to insert (after some practice), and COMFORTABLE. You will need to be open to the fact that you’re going to be getting up close and personal with your lady bits, but the more you insert and remove, the easier it gets. No leakage, no need to constantly check, no ruined underwear. I am in love and never going back!
customer_reviews.author: Megan C

customer_reviews.title: Life changing. Literally.
customer_reviews.text: This thing has literally changed my life. I have ISSUES and no doctor can figure it out. I cannot leave my house without an actual adult diaper when I’m on my period and it lasts on average 2 WEEKS. I do have to empty it every 3-4 hours (I got the large) BUT I was able to play in pool with my kids today and get groceries worry free.
customer_reviews.author: Kira

customer_reviews.title: Great for overnight or at home!
customer_reviews.text: I have just started using the cup, and it's great! I learned how to use it appropriately within my first period week. I have never worn it to school, just simply because I don't want a catastrophe on my hands with having to clean it in the girls locker room. Maybe if I didn't have after school activities, I would try it, but there is no way I would change it in a public situation. It's messy but I don't mind blood. I am probably going to just use it for overnight from now on, mostly because I HATE the feel of pads, they make me want to puke. It's also reusable and saves money which is great.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Sturman

customer_reviews.title: Active mom
customer_reviews.text: I am a very active mom. Three kids (all vaginal births) and I exercise (weight train) 4-6 days a week. I bought the Saalt cup first but it was too firm. Took me forever to get it out. The Lena has been perfect. Easy in and out, no issues while doing squats, lunges, yoga, etc. There is a tiny bit of leakage but I think I just need to check it after my workouts to make sure it still has proper suction. I wear a panty liner regardless though. I always have. I am still liking it better than tampons! Not having to change it all day. I can go 10-12 hours on my heaviest day!
customer_reviews.author: DaniCaliGirl

customer_reviews.title: No cramps!
customer_reviews.text: I’m so happy I decided to buy this my cramps are practically nonexistent??? I switched to this cup mostly because I’m tired of paying for tampons and I can put it in and not have to work about leaks and stuff for 12hrs but no cramps is an amazing bonus. I wish I’d known about menstrual cups years ago, it definitely takes some practice to get it in there right but once you’ve got that down it’s super easy ☺️. Also for the people that think it’s kinda gross I feel you but seriously if you have heavy periods or bad cramps it’s so worth it and fr tampons are gross too let’s be honest sooooo I mean why not??
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Heavy flow & 3 children = 4hrs max
customer_reviews.text: Love the concept and the actual product. I just think there needs to be a deeper cup option if possible.. I got the large one and I do it think it is considered heavy flow. Less than 4 hours my cup was completely full and I was way past just a little leak. I have had 3 children and 30yrs of age.. I wouldn’t consider myself a big girl around 150lbs... so I would imagine if a bigger girl with children or a bigger girl with heavy flow.. THIS WOULD NOT WORK FOR THEM. Please make a deeper cup that holds more. I will probably try a Super Jennie or LaliCup.. they hold 11ml more
customer_reviews.author: JAZmanW

customer_reviews.title: Save the money, and your panties.
customer_reviews.text: The first month was an absolute disaster. Leak after leak.. I watched all the videos, read the little pamphlet, tried all their folding methods and this thing just sucks. Tried it for a second month and same results. I thought with practice and familiarity it would get better but it didn't. I wanted sooooo badly to like this and for it to work, as I despise tampons and refuse to wear pads. All I can say is "Come on MENOPAUSE!!"
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love this one!
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this product. I was excited about not having to spend money on tampons and pads and be more eco friendly but this just did not work for me. I have super heavy flow due to endometriosis so I ordered the large. Unfortunately I couldn’t get it to be comfortable and it just wouldn’t stay in. I tried multiple times everyday during my cycle and still no luck. Trying out other products until I find one that works.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Lui

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: My advice: read read read, as many reviews as you can! I read reviews for days and finally decided to give it a try. I'm a first time "menstrual cup" user. I'm 30 and have had 2 natural child births. I have read so many reviews and ended up buying both sizes. My first day I used the small, then for 2 days (heavy days) I used the large and ened my last day with the small. I'm thrilled by this product and can't wait to use again. Don't get frustrated with trying to find the placement, you'll find it. Just try to remember how you got it there and relax!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa & Jesse L

customer_reviews.title: Daily leaks with Lena. Not with diva cup
customer_reviews.text: I had daily leaks with Lena. I first tried the diva cup. I loved that one. No leaks. I liked the color options with Lena so I tried it next. I had daily leaks. It was horrible. Such a waste of money on something that doesn’t do its job.
customer_reviews.author: Aldrich5891

customer_reviews.title: Could not get the small to fit
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had success with cups in general. I can use ones that have a flex ring and softer plastic cup since they fold up smaller... but I cannot get regular silicone cups to fit. No matter how I fold it and try to wrangle it, I struggle to get it past my pelvic muscles. When I do, it expands and suctions before it's anywhere near my cervix. Very uncomfortable and a complete mess to install (seems like a proper adjective considering the hassle). I've had this one for several years now and am finally giving up on trying. 30's / no kids / tighter than average lady bits.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Game-changer!!
customer_reviews.text: This honestly has changed the way I feel about my period! This is the 2nd cycle I've used it. There were some kinks to work out in the first cycle, trying the different folds to insert it and making sure it was in place. Now this cycle though has been issue-free. I don't worry about anything when I leave the house. I empty in the morning and before bed and have never had an issue. I'd still recommend a pantiliner for anything that might just not quite be sealed, but nothing has ever reached it. Seriously a game changer, ladies!! I will never go back!
customer_reviews.author: HappyMommy79

customer_reviews.title: Bought it, I'm thankful
customer_reviews.text: My periods are now over in half the time. I don't know why that is, but it's great. I love that there's nothing to throw away. Took a minute to get the hang of it, but now it's easy to handle. Read an article recently in my medical journal that the research results so far are positive, so I feel good using this. Been telling family, friends, and coworkers about it. I did get the small. I've had 5 kids, am over 40, 120lb, and 5'1. works just fine. no leaks, it amazing really. I bought Dr.Bronner's baby soap to wash it with, works well too.
customer_reviews.author: Franny B.

customer_reviews.title: Every woman should try it!
customer_reviews.text: It’s the first menstrual cup I’ve used and I wish I had gotten one sooner!! It’s easy to use and clean. Every woman should have the opportunity to try one of these. It saves so much money and decreases waste that goes to landfills. Plus it is safer and more comfortable than tampons. And there is little to no period smell when using these.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Best cup ever for me!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I've tried both the Diva cup and Mooncup, as well as the instead disposable cups, years ago and ended up going back to tampons because I always had leaks. I have a very heavy flow and decided to try cups again because all the stores around me have been sold out of ultra tampons for the last few months, and super plus doesn't cut it. I'm so happy with this purchase! NO LEAKS, even on my heaviest day! The only time I've had a leak was due to filling overnight. Not much you can do about that. It's easy to insert, pop open, and remove. I don't feel it one bit.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous about buying a cup due to not knowing if it would actually work and the mess of it. I have to say I am impressed by the cup and have not used a tampon since. I wanted the cup due to the impact tampons have on the environment and how expensive it can be. I am very happy with this purchase. The cup is easy to put in and take out. I have never had to take out in public which has been great not to deal with the mess in a public bathroom. I clean it in between uses as instructed. It is durable and I have recommended one to every female I know.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good brand, but not the right fit for me
customer_reviews.text: So Im a first time cup user and I decided to try this one because of its bell shape. I thought it might be better for me because although I've never had kids, I have never been able to use tampons without them leaking. I also ordered the large because I have a fear that my vagina is extra wide or something. But I dont think thats the case now, because this was definitely a bit too big for me. If you've had multiple kids then this might be good for you, but if your like me, slightly larger than average, a regular size or small cup is probably just fine for you.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Love my Lena
customer_reviews.text: It’s definitely a learning process I looked up videos and did some research and joined a small cup community on FB that lead me to but this brand. I advise that you try it out so you get comfortable with it. I love that I can sleep with it and not have to worry about waking up in a pool of blood (tmi but it’s what happens on my heavy days). I will be buying a second one for sure. Also if you are having cramps try adjusting the tail so that it’s facing a bit more towards your tail bone, that helped me.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: So stiff it hurts!
customer_reviews.text: This cup is so hard it feels like plastic. It’s way too firm for me. As I’m inserting it it’s opening and doesn’t allow me to push it al the way up. It started irritating me because of how harsh it was to insert. And yes I know how to use cups I’ve been using them for years. I’ve trued the Diva cup, Luna cup and the Lunnete. I’m not sure if this is a knock off product or if it’s an actual Lena Cup but I hate this cup. I would get a refund but my refund window closed.
customer_reviews.author: angel

customer_reviews.title: Not the right one for me
customer_reviews.text: I’m not really a fan of this one. I’ve never had a child, and somewhat petite-average. It’s pretty ridged and had to wrestle it in and out. I’ve had my IUD for 4 years never had a problem with my strings, but I feel like this has dislodged it. My strings are definitely longer, and currently waiting to se if my obgyn can squeeze me in to check it out. Suction is great and prevents leakage, but really had to wrestle it out. It would probably work for other folks, but for me it was a no.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi Kim

customer_reviews.title: No leaking!
customer_reviews.text: I was previously a Diva Cup user for about two years. I liked the Diva Cup, but I would always leak on my heaviest days, even while wearing their large. This cup is so much wider, which is exactly what I needed. I haven't leaked even a little bit! It also suctions right away; no need to twist it, turn it, pull it, bop it. I am very happy with the differences. The only thing I don't like is the stem. It's so uncomfortable. I might end up cutting it, but it helps me take the cup out because it's usually far up my vagina when I need to remove it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Have used this product for over two years and just bought another. (The old ones work great, I just prefer to have a new one every year... kinda like a new toothbrush every month;-) I have a period tracking app that notifies me when my cycle is beginning and so I just pop this in and wahla... no more surprises in my panties. It’s nice for traveling because I don’t have to worry about carrying tons of tampons and pads and I can exercise/swim with no problem. Also, when in a country where tampons are not sold, I still have my cup!!
customer_reviews.author: Pierce

customer_reviews.title: So glad I took the leap and tried it!
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous to jump on the cup bandwagon..but so glad I did. Easy to get the hang of, follow directions and you should have no issues. Took my a couple days to feel comfortable and that I had the hang of it. More comfortable than tampons, and if in correctly, you cannot feel it at all! Im a hairstylist, and most days I am so busy its hard to be able to take bathroom breaks...I was able to go 12 hours with this thing...which was such a godsend lol. If you are nervous about taking this leap, I totally get it...I was that woman. However, I highly urge you to take the leap you will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Lamperes

customer_reviews.title: First Menstrual Cup
customer_reviews.text: This is the first menstrual cup that I have ever bought. I love it and will never go back to tampons. It took me about 20 minutes to figure out how to put it in the first time, but after that it was smooth sailing. I wish that these were way more popular than tampons, I could not imagine going back to tampons after using this. Its literally a thousand times more comfortable than a tampon, easier to transport and store, and there is a much lower risk of toxic shock with a menstrual cup than there are with tampons. I highly recommend this product. Don't waste money or time with tampons, please buy a menstrual cup, they are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: madison

customer_reviews.title: Holy suction
customer_reviews.text: After using another brand for years I decided to try this brand. I sized up because I do have a heavy flow, and I definitely would only recommend the bigger size to seasoned users. The cup itself is great and does not stain or get gross. I did trim the stem a bit for maximum comfort. My only complaint is that the suction feels too powerful and when the cup opens up it sometimes takes my breath away. I also have had it pull my cervix down before if I wear it too long. These are qualities that can be good/bad depending on what you are looking for!
customer_reviews.author: cpuff

customer_reviews.title: im actually looking forward to my cycle!
customer_reviews.text: i have changed my mentality to menstruation positive mindset <3 this product keeps me comfortable, and i dont feel so frumpy. pads=frumpy ive had two natural births so i ordered the large, but i think i may order a small sometimes cause it does seem a little too large for me. taking it out and putting in is a little uncomfortable, but once its there i cant feel it unless i bear down. insertion and removal is why i want to go for a small next time totally buy this! if you have used the softcup menstrual cup this is nothing like it and i prefer it waayyyyy more!
customer_reviews.author: Ash Gundelach

customer_reviews.title: Eco friendly and effective!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this cup (size small) since 2017! There’s definitely a learning curve for any menstrual cup, but I’d say after the first 2-3 cycles, I was a pro with what position and what cup gold worked best for me! This is such a great way to eliminate/reduce single use menstrual products! Occasionally I still need a panty liner for the first hour or so of placing my cup in, but I’ve reverted to wearing a super light absorbency period panty (which are also getting very innovative and comfortable!) to catch anything that the cup doesn’t.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to get the correct size
customer_reviews.text: Just fyi this product suggests size large for people who have given birth and have a heavy flow. I ordered the small even though I have had a baby because I do not have a heavy flow. I have only used it two days and there has been quite a bit of leaking going on so I am ordering a large. Will update on how the large works when I receive it. Otherwise comfortable and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Callie Griffith

customer_reviews.title: I love this product and will never buy tampons again
customer_reviews.text: I love this product, and ordered a second! I will never go back to tampons again. I love how how much cleaner it is than tampons, more natural, and much better for the environment. No more embarrassing, smelly bathroom trash bins. No more last minute hunting for tampons, or paying ridiculous prices. No more worry about the first day leakage, it’s no big deal to start a little early. No more worry about soaking through, just empty when convenient. No more dryness from using tampons on slow flow days. No more messy cleanup. Easy to clean, and so convenient, no hassle at all. So freeing! I could do my workouts, sleep without worry, no hassle at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Not for those with truly heavy flow!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t use this on my heaviest days... I am emptying every two hours, and leaking even though it’s not full! (I do know I’m inserting it correctly and it is sealing. It is working until it is about halfway full, then leaking.) At least with ultra tampons and a pad I know I’m going to make it through the night, or at least halfway. Maybe I have an abnormally heavy flow? 3 stars because on light flow days this was fantastic! Worked like a charm, no spotting on my undies or anything! I will mainly use this while traveling on light/medium flow days, but my heaviest days I’m going to have to rely on tampons/pads. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel German

customer_reviews.title: Life changing
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my Lena cup. It took me a couple days to figure out what worked best for me, but it was life changing once I figured it out. It's like I'm not even on my period. No more cramping and bloating for me! It feels good to know I'm making a healthier choice for my body as well as reducing waste in the environment. Lena's customer service was also fantastic. I asked a lot of questions via email and everyone I talked to was very helpful and friendly. They have a money back guarantee too, so it's worth a try! Worst case, you don't like it and send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Kassie

customer_reviews.title: 1st Timer Approved
customer_reviews.text: I started out using pads and switched to tampons in high school, but I am now trying to be more conscious of what I throw away and this was my next step in the journey. I used that famous online quiz to help figure out which one would be best for my body and I was given this one. Let me tell you, it is great! So easy to put in and take out. Cleaning is a breeze. I cannot believe that I was so skeptical prior to trying it and I am so glad that the first one I tried fit me well. If the quiz gave you this one as an option. I would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Madison G

customer_reviews.title: want to make work, but it's uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: This gives me pretty bad cramps at the beginning of my period. When I take it out they go away. This isn't my first cup- I bought this one after my first cup (blossom) being too flexible. Well this is just uncomfortable. I got the recommended large for a 30 year old with medium to heavy flow. I gave it 3 cycles to see if it was just me. They emailed me 3 times to ask about my experience. Well I responded with my issues and they never replied
customer_reviews.author: Shanna

customer_reviews.title: Stop wasting money and ruining the environment with disposable period supplies!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time buying this product because I loved it so much the first time. These are so great because they are environmentally friendly and save me so much money on period supplies and are much more comfortable than a tampon. Most days I forget I have it in. Unfortunately, I used silicone lubricant on my last one which made the material get a little wonky so I had to reorder. I thought about going with another brand to try it out, but after the positive experience and this one having the best reviews of them all I didn't see the point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like this.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this.. but unfortunately, this isn’t for me. The first two days worked fine (after continuously wondering if it would leak in combination with a lot of pushing, probing and pulling to ensure the cup is properly in place-very messy). The next day (my heaviest) didn’t work so well as mine leaked. I can see how people would like these, but for me it’s too messy, uncomfortable/awkward and creates anxiety for me always wondering if it’s in properly or if it’ll leak. At least when a tampon is inserted, you know they’re in properly and will work. I gave this 3 stars because it wasn’t bad, it just isn’t for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Leaks and unable to return
customer_reviews.text: I purchased Lenf cup from Lena Seller and got it just after my period finishing. I waited for the next periods and tried cup. The cup leaks. I tried to return, but it turned to be impossible, because it is too late. How could I test cup without my periods? I waited for my periods and tested the cup. And it turned to be too late to return. Do not buy this cup here. You find out that the cup is bad when your periods starts, but there will be too late for return or refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Try other folds if you get leakage, suction can be strong
customer_reviews.text: Holy, the suction power on this can be so strong that it was painful... the 7 fold seems to work best for me, c fold always gives me leaks.. I had to reinsert it with the 7 fold since the first suction was hurting me, afterwards it was fine. This doesnt feel any softer than the diva cup but I like how it is more round than the diva cup because it feels like a more secure suction and I can feel if there is a fold in it easier... otherwise the roundness does make it a bit hard to remove since it is difficult to grab. I end up pinching myself pretty often...
customer_reviews.author: Dolly Buzz

customer_reviews.title: Buy this & thank me later
customer_reviews.text: I'm in love with this menstrual cup. Now, I haven't tried others, but that's because I bought this one because of the amazing reviews and I don't need to try others because this one works great. I will say that you need to get some practice with it before it works perfectly. And you need patience for removal. But once you know what you're doing it is the most amazing thing. No waste, saves money, no strings, less times you have to remove it, overall the best option.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn Rodabaugh

customer_reviews.title: Not for me.
customer_reviews.text: This product just didn’t work for me. I was looking for an easy, no-mess and environmentally friendly product. Unfortunately, after trying this for a few cycles- it just didn’t work for me. I experienced leaks- mostly at night. The feasibility of using the cup in public places is just too messy. I worried about cleanliness/sanitation. Overall, in all honesty, this product just grossed me out too much. In theory, the product is great but I’m quite unhappy with this purchase. I don’t think I will try another cup. I’ll be going back to organic tampons.
customer_reviews.author: Vegmom

customer_reviews.title: Nifty and life changing
customer_reviews.text: This cup has been so much better than any other one I’ve used, I’ve officially converted to only using Lena. Once I got the hang of what fold worked for me, using the product became a breeze. As someone who used to be a slave to heavy periods, it’s so refreshing to feel like nothing’s there now and be able to do everyday activities without worrying about changing tampons constantly. I can now change the cup a few times a day instead of what was at least double that before with tampons. I love how much more eco friendly this option is too
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Suction Power TOO Strong
customer_reviews.text: I am on the younger side, but I did my research and gound out that this cup is good for beginners. It went in easily enough, and came out with a loy of effort the first time (after 4 hours, not full). Afer leaving it on overnight, I had to have it removed at urgent care because it suctioned on too much and would NOT come out!
customer_reviews.author: yaybooks26

customer_reviews.title: Larger size is too big
customer_reviews.text: I have a kid and am in my early 30s and have a heavy flow so the larger size was recommended. Only used for one day at work and it was awful. I could feel the cup, there was discomfort I expected to go away but it didn't and I had the urge to pee constantly. But when I tried to go next to nothing would come out and what did was stinging. I finally took it out and was able to pee but it burned and continued to feel uncomfortable all day even after it was out. It's been sitting under my sink since.
customer_reviews.author: Amber  W

customer_reviews.title: I wish I started using this sooner!
customer_reviews.text: I really like using these cups rather than tampons. They take some getting used to. Getting it in and out is a challenge at first but once you get used to it it's a breeze. Only thing I wasn't aware of and haven't heard anyone mention in the reviews is that sometimes this makes it hard to pee when in. I don't know if it pushes on urethra or what but the first time it happened I was very freaked out. Looked it up and found out this is common. So if that happens, don't freak out like I did lol.
customer_reviews.author: RJH

customer_reviews.title: Changed my life!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first menstrual cup. Before buying it, I always had irritated skin and pain during my periods. A gynecologist diagnosed me with a mild bleach allergy, but I didn't have the funds to buy natural products every month. The Lena has been the perfect solution. I am having the most comfortable periods of my life! I did not experience the "learning curve" most users talk about. I was comfortable using the Lena after about an hour of trial and error. I've been using the Lena for about 5 months. I have never had a leak, or any other problems. I cannot recommend highly enough!!!
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement of tampons and pads!
customer_reviews.text: The first few times it was a slight struggle to remove but after I got used it to, I couldn't imagine going back. 85% of the time it works great. Once in a while, the suction must not be working correctly since I have leaked wearing this on non-heavy days. Make sure to care and clean for it appropriately, I don't think I did (used hot water and antibacterial soap sometimes) and after a continuous week of using it, the stem is slightly discolored. Overall, I will keep using this. It is a sturdier or less flex cup than the Lunette which could make it difficult for some people to put in.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky

customer_reviews.title: I never got the cup
customer_reviews.text: My dad visited the US so I asked for a Lena Cup because I've been wanting to start on more secure ways to deal with my period. I was very happy when he came home because where I live menstrual cups are still extremely expensive and not super high quality. Turns out that even though the delivery came rather quickly, the product wasn't even inside the box. I got the little purse, got the instructions, but never got the cup. My dad's suitcase didn't go through any kind of search when he was at the airport, the box seal came intact and everything.
customer_reviews.author: Júlia

customer_reviews.title: Life changing
customer_reviews.text: (Wife of account): Cups are life changing. You can wear it for 12 hours and not have to change it at all!! I prefer the sensitive version of this cup but this one isn’t bad. I can just feel it a little more than the other one. However, it does pop open quicker than the sensitive version. My only regret is not getting a cup sooner. It transforms your monthly period into something that can be easily forgotten.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Meuleman

customer_reviews.title: Still love it 3 years later
customer_reviews.text: Have had this same cup for almost three years now. If you’re on the fence, just take the leap. It’s totally worth it. Other cups didn’t work for me due to a low cervix but this one is perfect. It’s also a perfect color (white is just not a good choice!) the purple shows enough to keep it clean but it doesn’t look grimy. I’m about to buy a new one, as it seems like it’s probably time, but I’ll buy this exact same one again because it’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Coss

customer_reviews.title: I think it’s stuck....  *panics*
customer_reviews.text: So new to this thing and like the concept of not having to fill landfills with waste... that being said I have no idea if it’s user error but I can’t seem to get it to be comfortable without having it be high up within me and twice I’ve almost had panic attacks trying to get this thing out of me for 20 minutes. Also leaked at one point but comparable to what tampons have the potential of doing in the past. I’m not completely turned off but not completely sold just yet.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: This changes things...
customer_reviews.text: I first decided to use the Lena Cup in an effort to reduce how much waste I get rid of overall, and this product has been a dream! It took one or two tries to figure out how to best shape the cup upon insertion, but once done, it was easy to use again. In my experience, the Lena Cup cannot be used alone since there is some (minimal) leakage. To remedy this, I've paired it with some Thinx underwear during my time of month, which works pretty well and makes the whole monthly process a much cleaner experience. I would highly recommend this to a friend - though, make sure to have some sort of light back up :)
customer_reviews.author: Erin S.

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: The tulip shape make this easy to remove and I haven't had leaking like with my other cups (Diva Cup, Eva Cup). I will say when it gets heavy with blood, it doesn't stay in place well (kinda slides down) but if you're used to emptying every couple hours or have an average to lighter flow, it'll be fine. Also this is the only cup where I didn't have to turn it a quarter turn when inserting to make sure the cup opens up all the way. It does that right from the start.
customer_reviews.author: Cait

customer_reviews.title: In love!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow - I cannot believe that I lived my entire life without the Lena cup. I love mine and especially enjoy the freedom of never having to purchase tampons/pads again! This product comes with a cute, small pouch that can easily be thrown into a purse or backpack. Although I find it very comfortable once placed, it does take a bit to get used to inserting/taking out. I would probably not recommend to those who are uncomfortable with tampons. Otherwise, this is a a MUST-HAVE for women on the go, and I'd highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bina

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It took me a long time to finally buy this. It sat in my cart for months. Man am I happy I finally did. It is weird at first but easy to get the hang of. I love that I can go for longer than 8 hours now. I love that I’m not using disposable products anymore. So far I’m happy. I took a quiz online to find out what cup would be the best fit and it was right.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Once you get over the weirdness of it. I forget I’m on my period. I personally prefer to reach in and pinch the sides at the bottom to break the suction then using the tail. I left the tail just Incase I need it. Easy to clean feels comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Use and Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second cup I’ve bought and I’ve been using it whenever it’s my time of the month. For all you ladies who have the Nexplanon implant this is really helpful!! You never know when you get your period, but it will always be with you. It’s easy to use and clean. You just have boil it for 5 minutes. I have heavy flows and I don’t have any leaks. I don’t have to waste money on pads either! I’m very sensitive and I’m allergic to a lot of brands and tampons so I give this a 5 star rating! You don’t even feel it! Totally worth it!!
customer_reviews.author: Getzemani

customer_reviews.title: Game changer for teachers!
customer_reviews.text: As a teacher, this product is revolutionary! The fact that I can go 12 hours without being the least bit concerned about my period is fantastic. It is easy to use and cuts down my time in the bathroom when I need it most. I don't have to wonder if I brought enough tampons to make it through the day. I love the Lena Cup, and would tell all my friends if not for the fact that it is such a personal product. This product is sure to improve your quality of life. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: EWinter

customer_reviews.title: Life Changing
customer_reviews.text: A little learning curve the first few times in and out, but life changing! I have used tampons since I was 12 (I played competitive sports all through middle school, high school, and college). I have never felt cleaner or less stressed about leaks than I did with this. At the risk of TMI, I was going through super tampons in 3 hours on my heaviest day, but I could leave the Lena in for 12 hours with no worries. It was nice to not have to change at work (I am a teacher so I have approximately 5 minutes to walk to the bathroom and take care of business between classes). This will be great for backpacking and camping!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Steen

customer_reviews.title: Worth it but takes a while to get used to
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this cup for two cycles now. I’m still having trouble getting the right position, but once it is there it is seriously awesome. I was honestly surprised by the fact that I didn’t feel it at all when it’s in place. More comfortable than a pad or tampon and they last a whole lot longer. Im very active and spend a fair amount of time in the gym. I never notice it while lifting, running or any other physical activities. I’m not fond of the removal, sometimes it can be difficult even with following the directions and it can be messy. Overall I would recommend it, in the long haul it’s going to save me so much money.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Van

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE MY LENA CUP :-)
customer_reviews.text: Yes! I LOVE IT! Life saver! I wish I would have heard about these things years ago. I LOVE MY LENA CUP! I did a ton of research before purchasing to find one that was relatively not too expensive, good size and most importantly for me easy to remove so I need one with a long tip. Even with the long tip I added a string to help me remove easily. MY LENA has been just a life saver as I'm a medium heavy bleeder and was always overflowing with tampons and pads. Its also great when traveling as it holds enough that I can wait to clean it when I'm at my final destination when I have privacy.
customer_reviews.author: L. Battieste

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you get the right size for your vagina!
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to having a period that was easier. First off, I DID order the larger size thinking, Because my periods are really heavy, I needed it. WELL let's just say its not about the flow but the size of you...lol Oops. Second of all, it was very difficult for me to take out. :( I hope they make one that is a lot easier to break the suction! Maybe create a loop pull or pully system lmao I am going to order the smaller size to see if it is easier to take out. yay for TMI! But dammit, periods are normal and they're ok to talk about and review ok!
customer_reviews.author: Meg Meg

customer_reviews.title: Menstrual cups are the way to go!
customer_reviews.text: In the 2.25 years since I bought this cup, I've used tampons a rare handful of times. Easy to clean, though takes a few practice runs before finding the right position. I do not recommend a dry trial run; much easier with your natural lubrication. Downside: It can possibly interfere/bump into an IUD string; ended up using tampons and pantiliner a few times because of it, but every body is different. It could be perfect for you!
customer_reviews.author: Commuterific

customer_reviews.title: Try one already!!
customer_reviews.text: My friend told me about this. I’ve been through 3 periods with it now and I’m in love!! I forget I’m on my period it’s such a smart concept. It gives me cramps on the first day, but I’m sure that will stop once my body adjusts to using it regularly. It comes with instructions and there are many different ways to insert. Removal takes getting used to but wow I wish I found this before my 30’s!! Now I don’t mind my period!!
customer_reviews.author: Shamelle

customer_reviews.title: A girls best friend!
customer_reviews.text: I ran across this item,didn't know such a thing existed. Omg! I wish I had learned of this earlier in life. Wonderful invention! I'll never go back to regular tampons. I've had no issues with this product. I feel confident when going out when I'm on my period. It truly eliminated the concern of an accident occuring,like with tampons. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Environmentally Friendly Savior
customer_reviews.text: Per wife: Absolutely LOVE this product! Not only am I saving the environment, I'm also saving my vagina from having to interact with toxic, bleached tampons and pads!! I have since shared with every woman I know how Wonderful it is to not have to ever see your bloody mess, unless taking it out to rinse and clean to use once more! Thank the heavens I no longer have to worry about blood getting all over my underwear or staining my sheets during the night when I sleep!! This was absolutely a gift from above!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't a fan!
customer_reviews.text: I went for the larger cup, due to recently having a child, and having a heavy flow, even before pregnancy. The larger cup was way too long, and I was utterly unimpressed. I don't know how having a heavy flow means this large cup will fit up in there, but even 6 weeks post childbirth, the large was way too big.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Wienhoff

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t cup anything
customer_reviews.text: I used the Duchess cup before this. It was completely fine except the stem made it hard to remove. When it got lost I decided to give the Luna cup a try. It straight up leaked the first time and barely held anything. So I thought maybe I didn’t push it in enough. Second time around I got the same result. It only managed to catch like 3ml. It somehow gets pushed to the side. Btw I’ve never given birth before. I’m going to return this and place another order for the duchess.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: this cup is very stiff so it took a while to find the best fold method that worked
customer_reviews.text: As a first time menstrual cup user, I see the benefits. However, this cup is very stiff so it took a while to find the best fold method that worked. I find that the 7-fold is the best and not as uncomfortable during insertion as any of the other folds. I have the small size and it works well. I have been able to sleep throughout the night without bleeding through or leaking even on my heavier days. My sister bought both the larger and smaller sizes and said that when the large cup creates the suction it is painful but it fades quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Bindley

customer_reviews.title: This is great. I use it with always because my stuff is what NIGHTMARES are made of.
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome. It's not easy to get in. But it does. When I take it out it's hard to pinch it I struggle to get it out lol but practice will make it easier. The thing I love about this is when I finally get it out the stuff inside stays inside. it doesn't spill on me. It's crazy. I have fibroids and was wearing depends but now I can use this and change it every few hours. It gets heavy. Then I can add the period proof underwear and life is once again liveable. I make sure I push it ALL the way in. So it's nice and sealed
customer_reviews.author: Jannie

customer_reviews.title: I’ll never go back!
customer_reviews.text: I was incredibly hesitant to purchase this because I wasn’t sure I would like how it felt. I had always used tampons in the past and was a bit afraid of using something that I didn’t understand quite as well. I’ve had my Lena now through 3 or 4 cycles and I absolutely love it. It’s easy to use, easy to clean, and is definitely better for the environment! I also don’t need to worry about my septic tank (accidental flushing) or my dogs getting into my trash can. Amazing product!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan HoskinsonTop Contributor: Minecraft

customer_reviews.title: Good brand for first timers!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time using a cup. I wasn't sure what to expect and I think I had built it up in my head. It wasn't as messy as I once thought. I actually love it. However, I do have to say the removal process does take some getting use to and the first few time using the cup it is a little stiff. However, it does get more flexible and once you find your fold you are good to go! It's like anything new... Takes some time to adjustbut once you get the hang of it there is no turning back!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Wilkinson-Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Could NOT remove this on my own!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Without going into gory details, this cup does not fit everyone, even after answering the questions to decide the size needed. I tried it several different times. Each time, it got stuck and I could not remove it by myself! My options were to go to the ER or have my husband remove it. He struggled and it was very painful. We almost resorted to using pliers!! Menstrual cups are DEFINITELY NOT for me.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Fornash

customer_reviews.title: No more toxic sticks or diapers
customer_reviews.text: Best thing ever! I'm mad I didn't try this sooner. I was nervous but I've used this through 2 cycles now and I will never go back. The first cycle was a little trial and error but nowI've got it down. Leaked twice because I didn't have it in right(make sure the opening is around your cervix not just jammed in there) no problems getting it in or out (just gotta use those muscles) and don't bother with a "dry run" things aren't the same in there when it's actually "that time". But it's amazing can't feel it at all, I feel more free to move about, I can exercise normally and I even went swimming. Buy one! Lol
customer_reviews.author: T_cruz16

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow!!! This cup is amazing! I have two kids (one of which was just born 3 months ago) I ordered the large and it fits perfectly. It was a lot easier to put in than I thought it would be. I can’t feel it AT ALL after it’s in and I stand up (I think standing up makes it move into position better... if that makes sense). I have had zero leaking and no cramps whatsoever. It comes with a cute bag to put it in and really easy to understand instructions! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Chanel H.

customer_reviews.title: Where has this been all my life!!!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe I’m in my 30’s and just finding out about this awesome product!!!!! I accidentally came across this product and ordered it just out of curiosity, never expecting to actually like it!!! I more than like it, I love it!!! Sooooooo comfortable! No leaks! Water proof and more hygienic for swimming! No more buying tampons....yeyyyy!!! Environmentaly; less trash in landfills! What’s not to love!!! I have 2 toddlers and still ordered small and it fits perfect with perfect seal! Give it a shot!
customer_reviews.author: Mehrnoush Minor

customer_reviews.title: Menstrual cups for the win
customer_reviews.text: I like that this is pink, because the diva cup stained for me, which I didn't like. I prefer this one mostly for that reason. Both worked well for what their job was. I don't do tampons or pads anymore. Sometimes though, there is still some leakage especially on the first day or two of my period. But that is expected as some blood will already be too far down for the cup to stop it, so you may want to wear a panty liner for the first day or so. Definitely a fan of menstrual cups, and this is one of the best.
customer_reviews.author: Lucia

customer_reviews.title: so disgusting!
customer_reviews.text: This is quite possibly the most disgusting thing I have ever used! I was hoping it would work because I have a very heavy flow, but seriously, I just can't do this and be sanitary at the same time. You can picture that for yourself. GROSS!! Plus, I still leaked through it so I might as well do what I have been doing.
customer_reviews.author: kt

customer_reviews.title: Switch to the cup life!
customer_reviews.text: I am officially converted! I was originally very skeptical and borderline afraid to switch to the cup. I thought it was going to feel weird and I thought it was gonna be hard to remove and I’d end up with blood everywhere. I was so wrong!!!! 1. I can’t even tell I have the cup in there 2. No spills, no leaks, no mess! I’m so impressed with how easy it is to put in and take out and comfortable! It even stayed in place during my workouts. So I say if you’re thinking about it, definitely give the cup life a try!
customer_reviews.author: Kiera

customer_reviews.title: Can’t imagine going back to tampons or pad!
customer_reviews.text: There is a bit of a learning curve, and you have to be comfortable with your body, but I absolutely love this product. There was something in other feminine products that was giving me a bad allergic reaction- and after months of pain and changing brands and products (I even tried organic and natural products but it didn’t help) I had had enough! A full year of no longer buying tampons or pads, and I’ve saved a lot of money- totally worth the investment!
customer_reviews.author: breanna Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Leaks!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried other cups and never had a problem with leaking at all. This cup leaks whenever I'm at anything more than a spotting flow. I really wanted to like this cup because of positive reviews and it is really comfortable once it's in but I just can't deal with the leaks, it's ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica C.

customer_reviews.title: This is THE one!
customer_reviews.text: I have had a diva cup for a couple of years and tried to make it work off and on all that time, just didn’t happen for me. Then I thought I would try a different size and brand and BAM! This one is fabulous for me. I have a very heavy flow. It does take some getting use to inserting it. Definitely try different folds as all are not the same. But I’ll never go back to pads and tampons again.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Can't complain at all (1 year later)
customer_reviews.text: I bought the smaller size in colour pink about a year ago. The silicon used for this cup is more on the firmer side. I've felt softer cups. In my preference, this hardness is ideal as it retains it's shape well and snaps out into shape easily. The shape of the cup has remained as new. The cup is still performing as new. Suction hasn't degraded and it fits well. With every cycle I have learnt to place it better to eliminate any leaking. There is staining but I know there are means to remove staining. The cup comes with a little, high-quality, cotton bag that is not thin and doesn't fade.
customer_reviews.author: Wanja Muriu

customer_reviews.title: Life-changing!!
customer_reviews.text: I have never used any sort of cup before, so I was pretty apprehensive. I picked this one because I took a quiz online which suggested that this was probably going to work best for me. Inserting it and removing it definitely took some practice, but I am really loving it! Once it's in, you can't even feel it, and I literally left it in ALL NIGHT with no other protective layer and there was no spillage whatsoever...I could cry lol. I definitely recommend switching to the cup!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the Lena cup for a while and it has SAVED me. I've converted to menstrual cups for good. I still need to use one pad in case of leakage because I bleed heavily for 3-4 days and then it gets better by 4-6 where I don't need to use a pad. Before using the cup, I'd have to line my panties with two pads because I'm so paranoid about coughing or sneezing and then disaster strikes.
customer_reviews.author: Suong Le

customer_reviews.title: Life changing!
customer_reviews.text: After using my cup for several months I wanted to write a review. This little cup is amazing! It does take a little while to get use to how to insert and remove, but I quickly caught on. The customer service reached out to me after my order to make sure I was comfortable with the cup, which I find that very comforting. Girls go for this product!! I love not EVER having to use chemical soaked tampons again and literally throwing money in the trash every month. And this cup is going to be phenomenal this summer during my many trips to the beach.
customer_reviews.author: GWMom

product_meta.title: Lena Menstrual Cup - Reusable Period Cup - Tampon and Pad Alternative - Regular Flow - Small - Pink
feature_bullets: A BETTER PERIOD. Lena is a reusable menstrual cup that collects your monthly blood flow. Inserted like a tampon, Lena Cup offers a complete protection and an odorless and sensation-free period. Join thousands of first-time menstruation cup users who say they will never go back to using pads and tampons.

STAY ACTIVE AND COMFORTABLE. Dance, run, swim and sleep with your Lena Cup – think of all the times your period held you back! Easy to insert and remove, Lena is ideal for menstruating users of all ages – wear your cup for up to 12 consecutive hours.

MADE IN USA. Lena is the most affordable USA-made feminine hygiene cup on the market. Lena uses US medical grade silicone and dyes to ensure complete safety so you can trust your body is getting the best.

AS NATURE INTENDED. Abnormal pap smears, rashes and yeast infections have been linked to the use of pads and tampons. Choose a healthier period – Lena Menstrual Cup only collects your blood without drying out your vagina.

ECO-CONSCIOUS. Reduce the environmental impact of your period by switching to a reusable cup. With proper care, the same Lena Cup can be reused for many years. Our 100% recycled packaging is chlorine-free and printed using vegetable-based inks.
